intro: Argostemma apiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It is native to parts of Asia, including China and India, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
